data.title: Not the buffet
data.text: So I have eaten here 3 times and each and every time I have gotten sick. Twice with the buffet (thought maybe it was a fluke) and once just ordered enchiladas... wont go back

data.title: Genuine Mexican food and atmosphere
data.text: I have always been served a delicious meal with hearty portions at Garibaldi's.  The atmosphere is purely Mexican as well as the decor.  The service is also good and the staff is friendly.  You may even be lucky enough to see the mariachis coming in with their musical instruments.

data.title: Good food and fun music
data.text: Coworker and I were in Pasco, picked this place randomly and it was awesome!  Great food, typical Mexican fare. And random Mariachi band playing made it feel festive and fun.  Totally lucked out with a random pick.

data.title: Garilicious
data.text: I go to this shop often. They outclass most fancy restaurants. Their buffet satisfies those that cannot afford expensive prices. If you have a modest income, their alternative menu selections will not disappoint you. Authentic mexican chefs, quality food, and a comfortable setting (not too fancy, but still great for family atmosphere). I would recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting above average taste at reasonable prices.

data.title: Good food  Great service
data.text: Nice little restaurant really great service we had the fajita special which was only $10 and I split it with my girl flavor was good plenty of food would definitely stop back in here and eat again .... There was quite a lot of us in the group and the waitress did a really good job keeping up keeping everyone's drinks filled and tending to all of our needs if you're in West Pasco and you looking for a good Mexican place I would stop here.......

data.title: Will try the very large Seafood cocktails next time
data.text: Spacious inside, bright & cheery atmosphere. The wait staff is very friendly and attentive. Food is good to very good. I saw some very interesting orders delivered such as very large oysters in half shells. Butterflied shrimp and several very large seafood cocktails. We will be back to try those dishes.

data.title: Lunch Review
data.text: There are many Mexican restaurant in Pasco to choose from. The service was attentive and we enjoyed our lunch. We had chile relleno and a steak burrito. The rice, beans and chips and salsa, all good but nothing that made us say "wow."

data.title: Authentic Mexican food!
data.text:
If you are looking for a cliche Mexican restaurant, this is NOT the place. The atmosphere is more of a cantina feel...stand alone table and chairs with no decorations. If you want an excelent meal, with exceptional service, this IS the place!
My husband had the molcajete special. A large molcajete filled with shrimp, chiles, mushrooms in a red sauce, accompanied by a plate of beans and rice. The shrimp was perfecly cooked and the sauce was nice and spicy.
I had the puntas guadalajara. The meat was tender, and the dish spicy. There was so much on my plate, I couldn't get through it all. We each had iced tea. It was the best $40 meal we've had in a long time.

data.title: Not as good as the last few visits
data.text:
I recently ate at this little gem again.  This time the service was stellar, but the food just wasn't as good as before.  The chips were a bit stale and the portion size was noticeably smaller.

While I won't stop coming just because of one visit I will be more weary the next time in.  Everyone has an off day, let's hope it isn't a trend!!

data.title: We like it here
data.text: The lunch buffet is a great value and the dinners we've had there have been very good.  It's a little less americanized than a lot of Mexican restaurants, but only a little.  Have the carne asada and expect to take some home unless you're a really big eater.

data.title: TOO LOUD LIVE BAND
data.text:
My mother and I went to Garibaldl's on 5th and Court Streets in Pasco, WA today, 12-22-13. We arrived just before 2 PM. We were immediately allowed to choose our table (there were only 2 other occupied tables in the place). We had great service by our server. We had a great table, very close to the big screen tv, where the Seahawks game was on. It was one reason we chose that place, was to have a nice, relaxing meal and watch the game. About 10 min after we arrived, several musicians walked in and within minutes, were drowning out the game with their too loud music (and singer who was off key). They began at the opposite end of the place from us, playing Nortena music. Soon after, more musicians started playing within 10 feet of us. It totally ruined the atmosphere, of wanting to watch and HEAR the game. Live music, mid afternoon on a Sunday, ughhh!! Not my idea of a good idea. Not a good place to go if you want a quiet meal with children, or a conversation.
The food was good. Shrimp enchiladas were tasty, but way too much sour cream.

data.title: Perfecto!
data.text:
Just what I was looking for.  I have eaten at Girabaldi's on three different occasions now.  I have been impressed every time I have eaten here.  The food is great!

The 1st time I went they were in the middle of a karaoke session and even the waiters & waitresses were singing.  It was load and boisterous, but the food was good so I went with it.  Lots of nice Hispanic folks eating, singing, and dancing too!

This last visit was a nice quiet lunch.  We tried the buffet and made 2 passes.  I enjoyed the food and making my own tacos is always a blast.  The two of us ate until we were content and had a beverage and the total still didn't make it over $20 total!!  Enjoy...

data.title: Love the buffet!
data.text: Garibaldi's has been around for years and years. Make sure you go there during the week and have their lunch buffet! Absolutely delicious!

data.title: Great food and Great drinks
data.text:
I have eaten at alot of the mexican food places in town and this is my favorite.

They always provide great service, great food, and awesome drinks. They always make my margaritas the way that I like them.

Theres a VERY SMALL "bar" (3 or 4 tables), but it is still pretty cool. 

They often have mariachi bands playing. If I have one complaint, it would be that the horns in the bands are VERY LOUD. While they sound great, the volume can be a bit overwhelming. It doesnt stop me from going there though.

data.title: Nice little place with a good lunch buffet
data.text: Good salsa, chips and guacamole - homemade for sure!   Buffet could have been a little warmer and meat a little less "juicy", but all in all good enough I'd go back.

data.title: Excellent dinner
data.text: We had a very enjoyable dinner here while visiting the area.  Great, friendly service, very tasty food, lots of music from two different bands.  I had prawns, which came with chilies, rice, beans, tortillas - all great.  We asked for some hot sauce, which turned out to be homemade and delicious.  The restaurant is not fancy looking, but I would definitely recommend giving it a try - the menu is huge (something for everyone), with lots of seafood - we were wishing we could try a couple more dishes.

data.title: Great atmosphere, but food is a tease. Looks good, taste says different.
data.text:
The chicken was not good, rice and beans were okay. 
Salsa was honestly the best part of my meal. /:

data.title: Best Mexican Quisine in the area
data.text:
Authentic south of the border food, atmosphere and staff.  I love this restaurant and I feel as though I am in a Cantina at times. I love going here with friends and family.  It is family oriented and full of smiles.
Great people and great food.
